It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glabrous, or hairless, leaves, which set it apart from other members of the species. The plant typically features small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
